newsitem.title: JAPAN: N.Korea tells Seoul to return submarine and crew.
newsitem.headline: N.Korea tells Seoul to return submarine and crew.

text.p: North Korea said on Monday South Korea must "unconditionally" return to the communist state a small submarine and its crew including the bodies of those shot dead.

"The south side must unconditionally return to the north the submarine and its crew including the dead bodies at once," a spokesman for the North Korean Ministry of the People's Armed Forces said in a statement.
The statement was carried by the official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) monitored in Tokyo.

"As far as a competent organ of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces knows, a small training submarine of a Korean People's Army unit which left Wonsan port on September 13 and engaged in a routine training on the north's East Sea of Korea might drift about with an engine trouble and strike a rock on the sea off Kangrung," the spokesman said.
"It seemed that its crew were left with no other choice but to get to the enemy's land, which might cause an armed conflict," the spokesman added.
